intro: Conophytum sororium, commonly known as the "Little Mother," is a species of succulent native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments and has a compact, rosette-like structure. Its leaves are often tinged with red or purple, especially when exposed to full sun. Conophytum sororium produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow, orange, and red during the warmer months.
